result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy S Seeger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Attorney Fees To Be Determined. 
Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

10:55 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amy S Seeger not in court.  Attorney Laura Ann Sutton in court for Amy S Seeger.
State moves to amend to county ordinance disorderly conduct 9.01.  Court grants amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court finds guilty and orders $367.50 forfeiture - 60 DTP.

10:48 AM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amy S Seeger in court.  Attorney Laura Ann Sutton in court for Amy S Seeger. 

10:49 Court relates and gives appearances.
10:49  Atty. Sutton asks for a Friday plea date; Court grants.  Plea date set before Judge Bitney for 5/13/2022 at 10:00 AM; must appear in person.
Bond to continue.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
